intro: Witheringia exiguiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered witheringia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth surface, while its stems are slender and often covered in fine hairs. Witheringia exiguiflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
